subject: Cybersecurity
title: MFA Fatigue: Bombarding Users Into Approval
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: MFA Fatigue: Bombarding Users Into Approval.

hook.text: Your phone buzzes with an approval request. Then again. And again. At 3 AM, exhausted, you finally tap 'Approve'.

buildup.text: MFA fatigue attacks spam push notifications until the victim accidentally or deliberately approves one to stop.

discovery.text: Uber was breached in 2022 exactly this way. A teenager spammed an employee with MFA pushes until they approved one.

twist.text: The attacker was 18 years old and part of the Lapsus$ group. They gained access to Uber's internal systems.

climax.text: Push-based MFA without number matching is vulnerable. 'Was this you?' must become 'Enter the number shown on screen.'

punchline.text: Uber's security was beaten by an 18-year-old pressing a button.

quiz.question: How did the 2022 Uber breach exploit MFA?
options: An attacker spammed push notifications until an employee approved one
